When dialects become vastly dissimilar, their separation may lead them to be recognized as separate tongues according to linguistic standards; thus, they lose mutual comprehension. According to Thomas Ricento, a scholar specializing in language policy and political ideologies, this phenomenon typically involves a socially constructed pecking order, which is established by influential authorities or prominent cultural outlets. In most instances, this ranking system does not coincide with the dialect spoken natively in that area. Typically, the dialect used as the primary language is deemed less esteemed.

In many cases of diglossia, the two dialects are so divergent that they are distinct languages as defined by linguists: they are not mutually intelligible.
 Thomas Ricento, an author on language policy and political theory believes that there is always a "socially constructed hierarchy, indexed from low to high." The hierarchy is generally imposed by leading political figures or popular media and is sometimes not the native language of that particular region. The dialect that is the original mother tongue is almost always of low prestige.

In his work, Plato proposes a viewpoint that emphasizes the presence of an underlying purpose in the universe. This perspective is based on the idea of order and structure existing prior to all things, which he first introduced in "The Republic." According to this theory, instead of creating something entirely new out of nothingness, the universe was formed through the actions of the demiurge who organized chaos into harmony, mirroring the timeless patterns known as the eternal forms.

Plato's teleological perspective is also built upon the analysis of "a priori" order and structure in the world that he had already presented in "The Republic". The story does not propose creation "ex nihilo"; rather, the demiurge made order from the chaos of the cosmos, imitating the eternal Forms.

Her pursuit of academic excellence culminated with full-time attendance at Tufts University, earning her a distinguished master’s degree in drama in 1980. This accomplishment laid the foundation for further accolades, including being honored with the prestigious Tufts University Alumni Association for Distinguished Service to Profession award in 1994. In addition to bolstering her education through teaching, she made her mark on the world of theatre by directing Harold Pinter’s “The Lover” in 1979.

This was followed by her full-time enrollment at Tufts University, where she earned a master's degree in drama in 1980. She later received the Tufts University Alumni Association for Distinguished Service to Profession award in 1994. To supplement her scholarship, she taught acting and made her director's debut in Harold Pinter's "The Lover" (1979).

The attack on Hage Village during the elf reincarnation arc was led by a warrior wielding enchanted powers who claimed allegiance to a higher authority. It was only through the intervention of two unlikely heroes that the village was spared. Their names were Asta and Yuno.

Asta and Yuno had been brought up under the watchful eye of an elderly nun named Sister Lily, who took care of them ever since they were mere children. Although she once worked within the walls of a grand temple in the Kingdom, her heart grew disillusioned with the institution's discriminatory practices against those with magical abilities. This caused her to seek refuge in Hage Village, where she could tend to their needs and offer guidance whenever necessary. Despite her stoic exterior, there lay a warm and caring soul beneath the surface. Her compassionate nature made her the ideal mentor for two fragile souls like Asta and Yuno.

During the elf reincarnation arc, he and the rest of Hage Village are attacked by a Purple Orca possessed magic knight but is saved by Asta and Yuno.
Sister Lily.
 Sister is a young Nun and caretaker of the Church in Hage Village who helped raise Asta and Yuno from the time they were young boys. She used to work for a church in the noble realm but left due to magical discrimination in the church. She has a kind demeanor that can turn serious when required.

In terms of the previous passage, it should be noted that there existed two distinct corridors which were situated on either side of two separate regions; one being located across southern Spain known as the Betic Corridor while the other was found across northern Morocco referred to as the Rifian Corridor. It was indicated that the Betic Gateway shut down approximately six million years ago resulting in the occurrence of the Messinian Salinity Crisis (MSC). On the other hand, the closure of the Rifian Gateway happened at an earlier time during the Tortonian period specifically between 11.6 and 7.2 million years ago. This event is commonly referred to as the “Tortonian Salinity Crisis” and occurred prior to the MSC and lasted for a considerably extended duration.

As mentioned, there were two earlier gateways: the Betic Corridor across southern Spain and the Rifian Corridor across northern Morocco. The Betic closed about 6 mya, causing the Messinian salinity crisis (MSC); the Rifian or possibly both gateways closed during the earlier Tortonian times, causing a "Tortonian salinity crisis" (from 11.6 to 7.2 mya), long before the MSC and lasting much longer.

"In 1994," revealed drummer Fergal Lawler, "[a]nd then you can find yourself on the opposite end of the spectrum where nobody buys your albums because you're too out there. Fortunately, we sit somewhere right in between. Our sound is an amalgamation of pop, rock, and alternative." To showcase this unique fusion, the band decided to create a music video for their single "Zombie." Directed by Samuel Bayer and produced by Doug Friedman and HSI Productions, the clip premiered in October of the same year.

Drummer Fergal Lawler said, "[t]hen you can go to the other extreme of being so alternative that no one buys your records. Luckily, we're kind of in the middle. We're a mix of pop, rock and alternative, I suppose".
 Music video.
 Background and production.
"Zombie" was released with a music video in October 1994. The video was directed by Samuel Bayer, and produced by Doug Friedman and HSI. Productions.

Brain damage resulting from external factors such as physical trauma or head injuries falls under the umbrella of traumatic brain injury (TBI). This condition is distinguished from other forms of acquired brain injury (ABI) that encompass injuries caused by various reasons like genetics or congenital disorders. The two types of TBIs are primary and secondary, while focal and diffuse brain injury terms indicate the level of harm and specific location within the brain.

A common category with the greatest number of injuries is traumatic brain injury (TBI) following physical trauma or head injury from an outside source, and the term acquired brain injury (ABI) is used in appropriate circles to differentiate brain injuries occurring after birth from injury, from a genetic disorder (GBI), or from a congenital disorder (CBI). Primary and secondary brain injuries identify the processes involved, while focal and diffuse brain injury describe the severity and localization.

The Brain Wave Scanner had left Storm Shadow, Billy and Baroness under its control at the conclusion of the previous series, prompting Snake Eyes to embark on a quest to rescue his friend. In the final chapter, Storm Shadow reverted to his status as a ninja and vowed to confront Snake Eyes whenever the time was right. Snake Eyes and Scarlet subsequently returned to their residence in the High Sierras, only to discover that Timber had passed away there but had fathered a set of puppies prior to his demise. Snake Eyes then adopted one of the pups as his own.

Since Billy, Storm Shadow, and the Baroness were left under the influence of Cobra's Brain Wave Scanner at the end of the original series, Snake Eyes is on this mission to save Storm Shadow. At the end of this story, Storm Shadow returns to his ways as a ninja, and says he will deal with Snake Eyes when he is ready. Snake Eyes and Scarlett move back to his home in the High Sierras, where Timber has died but sired a litter of pups before passing, and Snake Eyes adopts one.

In the year mentioned, she featured her soothing voice on Naturopath Julie Langton-Smith's sleep therapy CD, entitled "Sleep Talk Lullaby." This marked her first release in sixteen long years. Titled "A Love Story," this album was put out under her independent record label, Stargazer Records, on the 11th day of October, 2019. Although she commenced working on this project back in 2012, she paused briefly to attend to her mom's health needs.

That same year, she sang a lullaby on naturopath Julie Langton-Smith's sleep therapy CD "Sleep Talk Lullaby".
 Her first album in sixteen years, titled "A Love Story", was released by her own label, Stargazer Records, on 11 October 2019. She had begun work on the album in 2012, but took a break to care for her mother.

This group consists of inmates who have been selected for an infiltration mission that will lead them to the distant island of Corto Maltese.

The removal of a television program from an Indian channel due to explicit content review by the country's broadcast ministry has caused significant criticism and outrage among viewers. Meanwhile, the American animated series "South Park" found itself on streaming platform Netflix India in 2019, despite the same explicit language and nudity that once led to its ban in India, with a mature rating of 18+.

According to VH1 India's channel head Ferzad Palia, after being reviewed by the Indian Ministry of Broadcasting, the show was banned for its vulgarity. However, in 2019, South Park was added to Netflix India, where it is rated 18+ for strong language and nudity.
Criticism and protests.

Initially, upon hearing about Tybalt's demise, Juliet was overwhelmed with grief; but later on, this sentiment shifted to one of despair as she mourned for Romeo's exit from her life. In an effort to alleviate her suffering, Capulet made a grave error in judgment by believing her pain stemmed from the recent tragic event involving their family foe. Subsequently, he proposed a plan to remedy her melancholy - one which entailed a union with Count Paris under the condition that she relinquished control over her own choices and succumbed to her father's authority.

Later, however, when Juliet is grieving over Romeo's departure, Capulet thinks her sorrow is due to Tybalt's death, and in a misguided attempt to cheer her up, he wants to surprise her by arranging a marriage between her and Count Paris. The catch is that she has to be "ruled" by her father and to accept the proposal.

On the thirty-first day of March 2021, the government agency responsible for regulating liquor sales in the province of Ontario decided to end its cooperation with Air Miles and no longer accepted the reward program points in its physical and online shops. In the same year, two prominent Canadian companies, namely Staples Canada and the parent company of Sobeys and Safeway stores, also chose to sever ties with Air Miles. The former ceased to accept Air Miles credit cards from July onwards while the latter announced plans to gradually phase out the program's usage starting from August 10th, 2022.

On March 31, 2021, Liquor Control Board of Ontario ended their partnership with Air Miles and stopped accepting Air Miles at all of their retail and online store.
 In 2022, Staples Canada and the parent of Sobeys and Safeway stores ended their partnerships with Air Miles. Staples stopped accepting Air Miles cards in July of that year, and Sobeys and Safeway stores will begin phasing out acceptance of Air Miles after August 10, 2022.

To this day, there are multiple budget airlines offering round-the-year global services from Terminal 1. For instance, Vueling provides non-stop flights to Barcelona, while easyJet operates frequent trips to London (Luton), Manchester, Geneva, and Basel. Remarkably, in 2015, owing to rising demand and subsequent extension of the terminal, Israel Airports Authority decided to allow all low-priced carriers access to Terminal 1 under specific stipulations. As compared to other terminals, flights originating from Terminal 1 entail reduced airport tariffs.

As of 2010, several low-cost carriers' international flights were operating out of Terminal 1 year-round including Vueling flights to Barcelona and easyJet flights to London (Luton), Manchester, Geneva, and Basel. In 2015, due to increased demand and following another expansion of the terminal, the Israel Airports Authority made Terminal 1 available to all low-cost carriers under certain conditions. Flights operating out of Terminal 1 are charged lower airport fees than those operating out of Terminal 3.

In their rankings of the top TV shows of 2018, Vanity Fair placed "Killing Eve" at number two, highlighting the show's refreshing take on prestige dramas with its sharp wit and stylish presentation. The publication encouraged viewers to come for the dark humor but stay for the sophisticated costumes and intriguing plot twists.
On the other hand, Rolling Stone ranked "Killing Eve" as the fourth-best TV series of the year, praising its ability to blend thrills and suspense with clever banter and insightful commentary on gender dynamics in modern relationships. According to the magazine, the show was both exciting and terrifying, offering an unforgettable viewing experience that kept audiences hooked from start to finish.

"Vanity Fair" listed the show at second place on its "Best TV Shows of 2018" list, saying that "watching "Killing Eve" is like spraying a disinfectant for the musty tropes of prestige drama directly onto your brain" and inviting viewers to "come for the black comedy; stay for the fashion".
"Rolling Stone" named the show as the fourth best TV show of 2018, describing it as "exciting and scary while making room for the quippy dialogue and smart observations about how women interact".

The vehicle known as the EX was designed with comfort and convenience in mind for its six lucky passengers. In place of the standard bench seating arrangement, two captains chairs were removed from the second row to provide extra space for those on board. Additionally, this car came equipped with several features such as a rooftop rack, stylish alloy wheels, an adjustable driving seat with power functions, a moonroof that could be opened remotely, a sophisticated locking mechanism for keys, hazy light sources (available only in newer models), colorful side accents along with mirrors, and a powerful sound system that included six speakers capable of delivering up to 200 watts of sound.

The EX accommodated six passengers (using two removable second row captain's chairs in lieu of the bench) and offered additional equipment including a roof rack, alloy wheels, power driver's seat height adjustment, power moonroof, remote keyless entry system, fog lights (later model years), body-colored side moldings and mirrors, map lights, and 200-watt AM/FM/cassette six-speaker audio system.

In July of 2005, Rachel Fox wed the renowned British actor Jared Harris, who happens to be the son of the celebrated Irish actor Richard Harris. However, news broke out in 2008 that the couple had decided to go separate ways. Consequently, Jared filed for divorce in January 2009 due to the breakdown of their long-distance relationship and Rachel's heartbreaking miscarriage that took place in 2007. After separating from Jared, Rachel started dating actor Jeremy Gilley, and by May 2010, rumors circulated about Rachel being pregnant with their child.

In July 2005, she married the British actor Jared Harris, the son of the Irish actor Richard Harris. The couple announced their separation in 2008, and Harris filed for divorce in January 2009. The divorce followed the breakdown of their long-distance relationship and her 2007 miscarriage.
 Following her separation from Harris, Fox began a relationship with actor Jeremy Gilley, and in May 2010 it was reported that Fox was pregnant with their child.

The foundations of contemporary international law can trace their roots back to the time when the principle of state sovereignty was first established, which occurred during the Peace of Westphalia. In this historic agreement, nations pledged to respect each other's territorial integrity, thereby laying the groundwork for the inviolability of borders and the prohibition of foreign interference in internal matters of independent states. Despite this seminal role played by the Westphalian accord, many contemporary scholars contend that its significance has been overstated, leading them to refute what they refer to as the "Westphalian Legend." They argue that a more nuanced understanding of historical developments is needed before attributing such profound influence to an event from several centuries ago.

Some scholars of international relations have identified the Peace of Westphalia as the origin of principles crucial to modern international relations, including the inviolability of borders and non-interference in the domestic affairs of sovereign states. This system became known in the literature as Westphalian sovereignty. Most modern historians have challenged the association of this system with the Peace of Westphalia, calling it the 'Westphalian Myth.' They have challenged the view that the modern European states system originated with the Westphalian treaties.

In 1986, James E. Hansen gave a speech before Congress where he testified about his alarming findings regarding climate change. This event turned out to be pivotal in sparking a global conversation on this pressing issue according to professor Timothy M. O’Donnell of the University of Mary Washington. Not only did Hansen ignite public discourse around global warming, but he also shifted the focus of the debate from a purely scientific matter to one rooted deeply within politics. As explained by Richard Besel, a professor at California Polytechnic State University, this momentous occasion represented a crucial juncture in the annals of international climate change. Similarly, as per the analysis of science historian Spencer R. Weart, Hansen’s testimony played a vital role in raising the general public’s consciousness of climate change.

According to science historian Spencer R. Weart, Hansen's testimony increased public awareness of climate change. According to Richard Besel of California Polytechnic State University, Hansen's testimony "was an important turning point in the history of global climate change." According to Timothy M. O'Donnell of the University of Mary Washington, Hansen's testimony was "pivotal," "ignited public discussion of global warming and moved the controversy from a largely scientific discussion to a full blown science policy debate," and marked "the official beginning of the global warming policy debate."

On October 12th, 2017, Dappy unveiled his second track under the PlayDirty label titled "Spotlight." The tune climbed to a respectable position of 56 in the UK Singles Chart. Subsequent releases included the collaboration with Ay Em on "Oh My," which reached a peak of 23 in the charts. Following this success, Dappy put out the track "All We Know," which also did well, reaching a high point of 64. As an added treat for his fans, he released an acoustic version of "Count on Me" on YouTube.

On 12 October 2017, Dappy released his second single under the PlayDirty management called "Spotlight"; this song charted at 56 in the UK Singles Chart.
 In 2018, he released his single "Oh My" featuring fellow British rapper Ay Em. It peaked at 23 in the charts. He followed this up with the song "All We Know" which peaked at 64 and released an acoustic onto YouTube called "Count on Me".
